column4: Guys, I was trying to update my system yesterday, and update notifier interrupted, and I tried to do a sudo apt-get today, and I got this: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/38516/
the freecontrib servers are down -- you need to remove those entries from your sources.list
That's done!  The errors are gone, but Nautilus is still fubar!
sudo sh -c "aptitude remove nautilus; aptitude install nautilus"
I'M Baaaaccccck!   What was that you were saying about the reinstalling nautilus?
you'll need to get to the terminal and do -- sudo sh -c "aptitude remove nautilus; aptitude install nautilus"
do those errors (http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/38519/) make sense to you?
just to make sure we are on the same page -- you must have killed all desktop applications and be at the terminal
how to kill all desktop apps and still be in xchat?
CTRL+ALT+F1 -- login there -- and run  -- sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop  -- then run this -- sudo sh -c "aptitude remove nautilus ubuntu-desktop; aptitude install nautilus"
you cant -- you'll need to skip xchat for a few minutes
what does borked mean? how is nautilus misbehaving? can you show us a screenshot of the problem? etc
Sure, I'll post a screenshot.  Borked was just the word that thoreauputic used in place of another 4 + 2 letter word.
you could try purging the ~/.nautilus directory
